alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 01 at 9:35PM EDT until April 09 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River near Bedford to Williams and White River at Hazleton to Petersburg. .While flooding continues along much of the White River and East fork of the White River, levels have crested and are steadily beginning to fall. More precipitation is in the forecast and this will result in prolonged flooding including a secondary rise in levels bringing some locations back above flood stage by early to mid next week. Those with interests along area waterways should monitor forecasts for the latest information. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY, APRIL 09... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until Sunday, April 09. * IMPACTS...At 23.5 feet, Extensive flooding in progress with several bottom land roads flooded in Pike County in March 2011. Pike County roads flooded...some by several feet of water...east of SR 57 included CR 750N...CR 600N and CR 1000E. Pike County roads flooded west of SR 57 included...River Rd...CR 250W...CR 400W...CR 675N...CR 700N...CR 1000W...CR 900W...CR 700W and CR 775W. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EDT Saturday /7:30 PM CDT Saturday/ the stage was 23.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EDT Saturday /7:30 PM CDT Saturday/ was 23.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Saturday evening and continue falling to 8.9 feet Tuesday, April 11. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
